thread.title: The Rockettes kick up their heels for 2015
thread.title_full: The Rockettes kick up their heels for 2015

title: The Rockettes kick up their heels for 2015
text:
The Rockettes kick up their heels for 2015 4:51pm EDT - 01:27 
The Rockettes are busy practicing six hours a day in preparation for the 2015 Radio City Christmas Spectacular that will include old and new numbers. Elly Park reports.   
They are tall, talented and an integral part of Christmas in New York since 1933. The Rockettes, the all-female dance company known for their synchronized routines are kicking things into high gear in preparation for the iconic Radio City Christmas Spectacular show. While many numbers have stayed the same throughout the years, some are new explains director and choreographer Julie Branam. SOUNDBITE: Julie Branam, Director And Choreographer Of The Radio City Christmas Spectacular, saying (English) "There is new technology, we change the way the stage - different technologies of the stage, so that makes things different. We changed choreography, we added new scenes. We are doing 'Rag Dolls' which is a classic from the 40's, but it's been updated for this century." What's stayed the same throughout the years is the Holiday spirit that comes with being part of the iconic dance troupe, says four-time Rockette Tenise Mitchell Ellis. SOUNDBITE: Tenise Mitchell Ellis, Rockette, saying (English) "You literally feel the spirit of Christmas and joy that is just surrounding you every year you are here. Definitely I have a daughter of my own actually and I can now start my own family tradition here. I can bring her in. And so many families from near and far come to Radio City Christmas Spectacular and now I can do the same for myself." This season the shows kick off on November 13th, and until then these dancers will be practicing six hours a day to straighten out every little detail.  //reut.rs/1MsApVy
